question: Match List-I with List-II for the following reaction pattern of Glucose:
| List-I (Reagents) | List-II (Structural prediction) |
| a. Acetic anhydride | i. Glucose has an aldehyde group |
| b. Bromine water | ii. Glucose has a straight chain of six carbon atoms |
| c. Hydroiodic acid | iii. Glucose has five hydroxyl group |
| d. Hydrogen cyanide | iv. Glucose has a carbonyl group |
explanation: Acetylation with acetic anhydride confirms 5 -OH groups (a-iii).
Oxidation with Bromine water (mild oxidant) confirms aldehyde group (b-i).
Reduction with HI confirms straight carbon chain (c-ii).
Reaction with HCN confirms carbonyl group (d-iv).
